subject: I Hate Football
event:
Finally home from all my travels, no major events to fill up my weekend, a Sunday free for football... and both my teams go down in flames.

The Jets at least put up a fight against the Panthers.  Their D is for real.  And there was one cool moment, when Rex used huge DT Sheldon Richardson to pound in a TD.  But I still don't believe in Geno Smith.  How did he get back in when I wasn't looking?  Last I heard, he'd been benched and they were going to give Matt Simms a try.

The Giants game... I have called in the Men in Black to have that wiped from my memory.  5 INTs??  Oh, Eli, where are thou...

comments.article: I hear ya. I played Andre brown as my RB2 for playoff week 2 with Giovani bernard on the bench. Praying to Many-Faced God to eke this one out.

I only have the one team - the Jaguars - to mourn.
I can't imagine having 2 let me down so badly in the same season.
I think I'd have to take up drinking to drown the pain.
I feel the same way sky the skins. :) caps won though! :)

A Year ago i start reading your "A Song of Ice and Fire" Books, i'm currently reading a Feast for Crows and i must say i'm completely overwhelmed by your work.
I'm from Portugal, let me add that our translation is very acomplished, i have become a huge fan!
Just wanted to say a big THANK YOU for your inspiration and dedication and keep up this epic work ;)

Valar Morghulis

David Inácio
comments.subject: Your Fan

comments.article:
The Saints got their tails handed to them by the Rams in St. Louis...between that & the G-Men's loss (which I just happened to see, BTW) I was so disgusted that I switched it off.

The only really good thing to happen football-wise this week was "Evil Little Bill" and Golden Boy Brady getting bested by the 'Fins down in Miami.
comments.subject: Know how  you feel...

comments.article: The Giants meet the Seattle Beast!
Yeah well, your Jets dismantled my Raiders so how do you think I feel? No sympathy for you, my friend. :-)
Well, at least my hometown Bills had a rare good game.

Against my Jags.
Hesy sigh...
I am a Seahawks fan all the way... Even so, I thought about you while watching the game.
My thoughts exactly. Sorry George, but Go Hawks
comments.subject: Yeah...

comments.article:
From Ernie Accorsi's scouting report of Eli: "...When he's inaccurate, he's usually high, but rarely off target to either side..."

He's obviously reverted. In today's post game interview he said he feels like he's throwing the ball well.

Eli and the team need for this off-season to hurry up.

Rex did a fine job with the D. Unfortunately a team has to play both sides of the ball to be successful. Geno Smith was never a solution. Why they drafted him... maybe neither is Simms. My feeling is that they don't want Simms to take a beating, look bad and maybe lose confidence. They'll have Simms, Smith and maybe Sanchez or 'other' compete for the job during the preseason. Much like the Giants it won't matter unless they improve that O line and, and, and, get some weapons at receiver.
It might actually hurt them more in the long run that Ryan coached them to a mediocre record despite not having a true franchise QB.  This draft figures to be top-heavy with passing prospects.
Is that Eli Manning to whom you refer? Lol he lived like three houses down from me in college. Hotty toddy, yes? Don't do football but I occasionally ran into the dude at parties and such.
That's rough news about the Giants. However, it looks my Ravens are having a bit of a mini comeback. Well see!
They seemed pretty determined to get him that touchdown, they handed it off to him twice at the goal line on that drive.  Shades of the Fridge.
comments.subject: Sheldon Richardson

comments.article: My team is the Texans.  That should make you feel better.
You're just unfortunate to have been born and lived in a place where you became a Jets and a Giants fan.  It's because you love football so much that these loses are so painful.
comments.subject: No you don't

comments.article:
ASOIAF and all things Westeros have turned my world upside down for over a decade now.

Perhaps it’s "only fair" that my Seahawks provide the Giants with a bittersweet ending as well, if only for a weekend.
comments.subject: I Can Relate...

comments.article:
Hello, sir! I just want to tell you that I am a brazilian zoologist and I recently published one manuscript where I describe a new species of sea slug, named Tritonia khaleesi, in honor of my favorite character. I can not post links here, but I posted another comment with the links, in case you want to see the manuscript.

Thank you very much for your attention, sir!
comments.subject: Sea slug named after Khaleesi

comments.article: You said "favorite character"?... interesting...
comments.subject: Re: Sea slug named after Khaleesi

comments.article:
As a huge Jets fan that game was tough to watch, somehow we're still alive for the playoffs if the Ravens lose tonight lol... Also, Rex put Geno back in because, as I'm sure you know Rex's mantra, "he gives us the best chance to win."

Until the Jets get at least league average WR play however, us Jets faithful are doomed to insufferable offensive ineptitude
Eli can't lob balls near the Shermanator! You have to admit that Lynch TD was impressive...BEAST MODE! It's our year. Go Hawks!
comments.subject: 12th Man!

comments.article:
There should be Football in Westeros!

Or a Westeros Football version in America. With dragons and weapons and pits of fire where players can fall into.

Lots of fire and special effects. You could present it at Comic-Con.
comments.subject: There should be Football in Westeros!

comments.article: I am sorry....this has been a good season for me.  Colts win division, Manning breaking records. Hang in there, there is always next season.
Maybe the game of thrones themed south park episodes will cheer you up!?
comments.subject: Oh well

comments.article:
Hello George! The Giants...the Jets...oh my. I grew up in upper New York State and am a fan of both so I know how you feel! I hope Eli recovers his mojo for next year and the Jets ..just not sure what he is up to.

I have a question. Do you have a formula for your writing or does it just flow? When I was young my first exposure to you was Fevre Dream and I never forgot it. I am an aspiring writer looking for some guidance from the master!

Rob M
comments.subject: writing and the Giants

comments.article: I have this weird feeling that if the G-Men and J-E-T-S Jets Jets Jets had been more consistently good over the years fewer of our favorite characters would be dead. Then again, if the Giants hadn't beaten the Pats twice in the Super Bowl maybe Westros would have been destroyed by Asteroid Brady 19-0.
comments.subject: A Hunch
